FixDialogues.Description: Allows the mod to change most dialogues. You most likely want this set to 'true'.

ReplaceGenderSymbols.Description: Changes the male and female gender symbols into a 1 and 2.

FixBathHouseDoors.Description: Allows player to enter either door at the bath house.

FixBathHouseTiles.Description: Removes the 'W' and 'M' from the bath house doors.

FixOtherPlayers.Description: Changes multiplayer messages to use noun/pronoun settings below.

README1.Description: Values beyond this point will change the way the mod refers to you. If you want the default behavior leave these fields as is. See description for what each setting does.

Singular.Description: Changes all dialogue to use singular pronouns ('They is' instead of 'They are'). Does NOT work with MascLanguage/FemLanguage settings.

MascLanguage.Description: Changes all dialogue to use the VANILLA masculine version - If you use this do NOT set FemLanguage to true. If you do this setting won't take effect.

FemLanguage.Description: Changes all dialogue to use the VANILLA feminine version - This setting overrides the MascLanguage Setting.

README2.Description: Values beyond this point will change the way the mod refers to you. These fields will accept ANY input (including multiple values seperated by commas for randomized output) and use that in place of the default values. Values should be entered with the first letter capitalized for best results.

SubjectivePronoun.Description: The subjective pronoun to use. Examples include: he, she, they, etc.

ObjectivePronoun.Description: The objective pronoun to use. Examples: him, her, them, etc.

PossessivePronoun.Description: The possessive pronoun to use. Examples: his, her, their, etc.

Title.Description: The formal title you wish to go by. Examples: Ms., Mr., Mrs., Mx., Dr., Misc., etc. Special Note: The first letter should most likely be capitalized.

Adjective.Description: An adjective occasionally used to describe you. Examples: handsome, beautiful, gorgeous, etc.

SpouseNoun.Description: The noun which people will use to describe your marital status. Examples: husband, wife, spouse, partner, etc.

GenericNoun.Description: The noun used to refer to you as a person. Examples: man, guy, woman, girl, person, enby, etc.

AdultAntiquatedNoun.Description: The more antiquated noun some adults will use to refer to you. Examples: guy, gal, folk, etc.

AdultFamilialNoun.Description: The noun used by some adults signifying familial status. Examples: son, daughter, kid, etc.

ElderAntiquatedNoun.Description: The more antiquated noun some older adults will use to refer to you. Examples: lad, lass, kid, etc.

ElderInformalNoun.Description: The more informal noun some older adults will use to refer to you. Examples: son, hun, kid, etc.

ElderFamilialNoun.Description: The noun used by some older adults signifying familial status. Examples: son, daughter, child, etc.

ChildFamilialNoun.Description: The noun used by some children signifying familial status or familiarity. Examples: uncle, aunty, cousin, etc.

ServiceFormalNoun.Description: The noun used to refer to you by some in the customer service industry. Example: sir, miss, ma'am, esteemed customer, etc.

TraderNoun.Description: The noun used to refer to you by the Desert Trader. Example: sir, miss, ma'am, esteemed customer, etc.
